intro: Gaultheria thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the southern regions of Chile. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are aromatic, containing compounds that give off a distinctive, spicy scent. Gaultheria thymifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
